item.title: Safely Expose Credentials
item.description: If you’re juggling STS credentials while wrangling more AWS accounts than you can count, you’ve likely heard of aws-vault. Aside from the convenience factor, it’s also good for security (keep plain-text credentials off disk). Similarly, it’s obvious you don’t want to commit credentials. Depending how far you take that, even committing encrypted credentials (or storing them anywhere not intended for managing secrets) should be discouraged. One reason is building up muscle memory and inviting accidental commits of unencrypted secrets (use something like gitleaks to prevent that).
